dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for a while I was Executive Assistant to a Broadway Producer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What's a Broadway producer doing in Atlanta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mainly just rode around town in his limo, drinking and sucking him off. There's a moment of silence, then a realization... "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages    5-23-08    3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that I hear myself say it, I think he was just some rich chicken hawk. They get a GIGGLE out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well, he was a nice guy. I only dated him for a little while anyway. Then I dated this full-blooded Apache who made me dress up like a baseball player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apache? What was his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip- you amaze me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He was a nice guy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm saying- you only see the good. Phillip shrugs, but before he can reply- a piercing human SCREECH interrupts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inmate who spit a loogey into the mashed potatoes in the cafeteria is sitting up on his bed, SCREECHING at the top of his lungs. This is "THE SCREECHER"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip continues to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Screecher next door. He does it all night. I never get any sleep. He drives me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You poor thing. How awful... "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08 The Screecher continues his routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip emerges from the line munching on a candy bar when he notices a ruckus on the other side of the fence. He wanders over to see a LARGE PRISONER beating the crap out of the Screecher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna cut out your motherfucking tongue with your screeching all night. As guards descend on the two, the Large Prisoner continues to beat on the screeching SCREECHER. Phillip sidles up next to a BALD PRISONER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he care- he ain't in our block...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone probably paid him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reclined on his bunk, Steven does a crossword puzzle. Phillip enters, standing by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up... Steven sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you pay to have the Screecher beat up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bullshit me. Did you pay to have him beat up? "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you said he bothered you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven... A tear comes to Phillip's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most romantic thing anyone's ever done for me. He clamps onto Steven and hugs with all his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to be happy, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so amazing!!! And as they roll on the bed playfully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEAVON lays on his cot staring at the ceiling. Eventually a hand enters through the bars holding a cassette tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleavon- put this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man- not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How important? Phillip's hand disappears for a moment and comes back with a FIVE DOLLAR BILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten. "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. But you gotta play the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you- my word's my bond motherfucker. Cleavon takes the cash and puts the tape in a BOOM BOX. A familiar romantic TUNE begins to play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck man- Johnny Mathis? Fucking white- ass nigger... He buries his head in the pillow as "Chances Are" plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the MUSIC seeps into their dark cell, Steven reads a LAW BOOK by pen light. Phillip grabs Steven's hand and tries to pull him off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No... I can't dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I can't. I'm serious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, you're queer- it comes with the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well not me. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, I'll show you... He drags him up and begins his lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold me here... and here. Okay watch... Steven stumbles his way through the slow dance for a while, but with Phillip's help he begins to settle in. Soon they are nestled into each other, swaying sweetly to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MUSIC CONTINUES as a group of prisoners watch a VHS copy of GHOST on a TV. Phillip wipes away a tear and Steven holds him closer while, in the front row, a ONE-EYED LATINO jerks off to the sight of Demi Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah you fucking bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as tray after tray is filled with gray slop. This persists until suddenly two of the trays receive a beautiful STEAK and some SHRIMP. Steven nods at the Slopmaster and offers a wink to a very impressed Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES as Phillip and Steven shave side by side, smiling at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC plays on as Steven and Phillip continue their romantic dance. They are unfazed as the lights in the cellblock go out with the loud sound of circuits tripping. They dance on.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS OUT
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08 Eventually, the hollow sound of Johnny Mathis reverberating through the block is the only thing we hear. They dance on.

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS OUT
dialogues.text: They continue to dance. Footsteps approaching are heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said lights out. Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off or we're coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well come on in. I got a dick that needs sucking. CLANK! OFFSCREEN we hear the cell door open and the sound of a scuffle is heard.

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING BOND
dialogues.text: And as the sounds of a horrendous beating echo through the cellblock, Phillip and Steven dance their dance- oblivious to all but each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip and Steven sleep soundly together in the bunk. A CLAXON blares and their cell door OPENS- accompanied by the sound of a dozen others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rise and shine! They barely stir until-- CLANG-CLANG-CLANG! A GUARD hits the bars with his club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell!   Get up! Steven and Phillip are rudely awakened. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab your shit! Let's go! The GUARDS enter to roust Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're transferred. Nonney snitched you out about the Screecher. You're going to Ramsey Two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit... They grab Steven and yank him out of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Phillip tries to follow but a guard knocks him back down onto the bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you touch him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry Phillip- I'll-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and move. They drag him off. Phillip watches with deep worry as another guard keeps him there. He grows more and more upset, pacing and working himself up. Finally, the guard leaves and Phillip exits his cell and bolts down the tier after Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip runs after Steven, quickly arriving at a LOCKED GATE. Steven is on the other side, still being escorted away. Phillip is forced to find an alternative route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip marches through the common area, fighting tears. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip runs through another cell block until he comes to a window. He looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP'S POV: Steven is waiting in line with some other prisoners to board a bus. Phillip can be seen through the small window, but he fails to get Steven's attention. He bangs silently on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip continues in vain to get Steven's attention.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: He sees the line at the sally port start to move and stops to think. He knows what he has to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip runs down a breezeway. Eventually he reaches a heavily populated gate, manned by a YARD GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna go in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your horses Dorothy. The Yard Guard pushes a button that opens the gate and Phillip bursts through. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip runs through the yard, passing GIANT WOLF- WHISTLING INMATES as they put down their weights and stop their basketball games. Phillip maintains his focus on the sally port on the other side of the far fence.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Boarding the bus, Steven hears him and turns. Delighted, he's forced on board by a Guard before he can respond.

dialogues.speaker: STEVEN
dialogues.text: Steven gets in his seat and yells out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too! VROOM! The bus starts up and begins to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be together soon! I promise! The bus drives off. Phillip runs along with it for a while as they share a long goodbye. And eventually, the bus disappears from view. Phillip clings to the fence a moment, hanging on to hope. He slumps and turns- -only to find himself confronted by several HULKING MEMBERS OF THE ARYAN BROTHERHOOD with one thing on their minds. Phillip marches right toward them and as he draws close-

dialogues.speaker: GET THE FUCK OUTTA MY WAY
dialogues.text: Startled, they split to let Phillip pass unmolested. "I Love You Phillip Morris"      Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the present, Steven remains in his hospital bed at the Penitentiary Infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those were the longest three months of my life. I wrote to Phillip every day until I got released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANG!   The gate of the prison closes behind Steven as h exits.   He approaches a waiting TAXI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once I did, I was determined to get us back together as soon as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm well. Where you headed? The Greyhound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearest thrift store please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harelip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. You mind if I tell you the word of our Lord, Jesus Christ? The car pulls out, the prison receding behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same taxi pulls up in front of the prison and Steven emerges with a BRIEFCASE, wearing a THREE-PIECE SUIT. He rings the buzzer at the front gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven approaches the DUTY OFFICER. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, my name's Steven Rousseau. I'm an attorney. My client is Phillip Morris. I called earlier. The guard checks his roster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmmm. There you are. Rousseau... Phillip Morris. Like the cigarette huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip enters to see Steven waiting for him on the other side of the glass. Thrilled, he rushes to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd come right away, but Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got work to do honey, I'm getting you out of here early. I got a hearing tomorrow morning, I got motions to file. The law don't sleep baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip, you are the sweetest, most gentle man I have ever met. And I know people have taken advantage of that. But I don't ever want you ever to lose that innocence. I want to build a life with you Phillip. I want to protect you. They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven stands over a desk, talking sternly into a telephone. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motion was filed, I presented to the DA and got a letter from the judge- I do not understand what the hold up is. I'm not some paralegal- I am Steven fucking Rousseau and I expect proper adjudication! PULLOUT to reveal he's actually standing behind a KROEGER'S SUPERMARKET DELI COUNTER in uniform as a HOUSEWIFE waits impatiently. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boyfriend's getting out of prison next week! She smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How nice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want mayo with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven slides paperwork through a slot in plexiglass window toward a RELEASE OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an early release order for Phillip Morris. The Officer glances at the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep- Morris- we got him right here waiting. CLANK-CLANG. The door begins to open as the Officer stamps some of the paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his lawyer. Phillip runs into his arms. As they kiss, the officer offers a surprised look. "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PARTY to celebrate Phillip's release. Steven and Phillip stand at the door as FRIENDS file in and greet him boisterously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillllip!     It's so good to see you... Another friend enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! You look great. Prison agreed with you. How do I get on that diet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you couldn't handle it- not unless we smuggled an espresso machine in a cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw in a Sicilian Barista and I'm there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Steven. Steven- Blake and Baylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Gasp) This is him?! This is your gay lawyer prison boyfriend?! Pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better than the guy who had you kidnapped. What was his name? Steven looks to Phillip, perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regroups, to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you all a drink? "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven works his way through the crowded apartment struggling to hold a few cocktail glasses for guests. He eventually arrives next to Phillip, who is having a great time with another friend- and older woman named EUDORA MIXON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get a bigger place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven I want you to meet my old neighbor- Eudora Mixon. She is just the sweetest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eudora...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eudora owns a little building in Montrose and she's having a hell of time with the builder. He sounds like a real asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His plans were useless and he's trying to sue me to pay him! I need your expertise Steven. Phillip says maybe you can help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could certainly try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you still practice law, having been to prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure- why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought- Oh what do I know? I'd just be glad to have someone I could trust. I'll pay your normal fee. Steven doesn't miss a beat. He smiles wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be my pleasure. Litigation is my speciality. Phillip beams with pride over Steven's decision. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eudora waits on a bench in the corridor, nervously glancing at her watch. Steven stands behind a column down the hall hiding and watching. He looks at his watch, then approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late but I've been hung up in court all day. Let's go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVEN'S POV: A beautifully ornate courthouse LIGHT FIXTURE hangs from a courthouse ceiling. ON STEVEN, staring up at it with admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Russell? Steven snaps out of it and responds to a waiting JUDGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful fixture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   It's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Honor, Ms. Mixon engaged Mr. Gage service in good faith and was given an inferior product. She is entitled to deem that work to be unacceptable according to the contract that Mr. Evans signed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terms of that contract were ambiguous at best. The truth is, defendant engaged my client for three years without full payment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor I have, in my briefcase, fourteen other contracts, all on public record, in which Mr. Evans entered into litigation with past clients of his! Eudora glances into Steven's opened BRIEFCASE. It contains only a SANDWICH and a PHOTO OF PHILLIP. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   5 The shocked LAWYER turns to his client (EVANS).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making me look like an idiot. He regroups and addresses the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, I don't have to tell you that none of this is admissable or applicable to the case at hand. Mr. Russell's histrionics do not erase the fact that his client is in breech of contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is right Mr. Russell- what do you have to say? Steven is stonewalled. He looks to Eudora as if to say, "What do I do now?" and it terrifies her. Desperate, Steven bangs his fist on the table and looks resolutely to the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand to be seen in chambers!! The judge and lawyer seem mystified by this response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okaaaaaaaay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lawyer sits impatiently while Steven peruses a wall of plaques, photos and diplomas. He focuses on a law school DEGREE from INDIANA COLLEGE OF LAW. Next to it, a PHOTO of the judge as a YOUNG MAN on a farm. He's from humble roots. A moment later, the Judge enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay gentlemen, let's get this over with, the two for one at the Crab Boiler ends at five o'clock. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages     5-23-08 LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seems to be cut and dried here, sir. I don't even know why we're back here. Mister Russell is treating this like an episode of Matlock. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll admit your honor- I'm a plain spoken man. I didn't go to Princeton. I didn't go to Yale. My education was modest. I went to a small school. I grew up on a small farm. But I passed the same bar exam as my colleague here and I am not going to let him push around this humble woman. This scores with the judge. JUDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point taken Mister Russell... He glares at the other lawyer with scorn. JUDGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but where are you going with this? STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's obvious where I'm going with this sir. A long SILENCE. The Judge waits and waits until something occurs to him. JUDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you talking about Marshall vs. Chao? Steven doesn't know what this means... But the other lawyer does. And he's not happy. LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Shit... Seeing this, Steven puffs with confidence. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor, that's exactly what I'm talking about. The Judge slowly nods to himself as he considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the courtroom with Eudora, Steven is ecstatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES! I did great! Can you believe how great I did!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You did very well, Steven. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I did great! Really great! I'm so proud of myself! You want half my sandwich?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! We're going out!    I'm paying!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip stands flabbergasted next to Steven in the middle of a large modern apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, it's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you'd like it honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we afford this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me worry about the money sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well I guess I better start packing boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we both need a vacation. Key West? Phillip smiles.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. KEY WEST COVE
dialogues.text: PALM TREES undulate on the constant breeze, inviting us to a beautifully solitary cove. Eventually Steven and Phillip's voices are heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been meaning to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? DIALOGUE CONTINUES OVER VARIOUS SHOTS of their romantic getaway to the Keys. In a SERIES of SHOTS we see where they've been and what they've been doing in the moments AFTER they've been there. - A Hammock blowing in the breeze. - A quaint COTTAGE nestled in the vegetation. - Half empty glasses of beer on the porch. - Dirty dishes in the cottage sink. The remains of a romantic meal on a table. The swaying palms are visible through the windows. - Footsteps in the sand. - Two beach chairs facing the surf. - Etc...   etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That birthday cake you got me in the pen? Where'd you get those candles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you know... just... people I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. But how? "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that guard? Skinny guy? Smoked a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lance? He couldn't been more than 98 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh he was such an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually- I was in the yard once. Another guard asked him to pay him back five. He opened his wallet and I saw this picture of a little girl about Steffie's age. So I brought it up to him once, just to get him talking. That's the thing about having kids, you know? Gets people talking. Shared experience. Builds bridges. Something I learned. Anyway he tells me he's worried about her- mamma was gone. We talked awhile. You know, I just listened. That's all. I brought up the candles just one time but mostly just listened... And the next day, bedtime, there they were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dialogue continues on the beach as we finally see Steven and Phillip enjoying the sunset by the light of a small fire on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know he'd do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't. I just knew I wanted `em for you... and I found a way to do it. That's all. Phillip smiles, eyes never leaving the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listenin' huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it... "I Love You Phillip Morris"    Green Pages      5-23-08 And as the sun sets on the shimmering water--

dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a Coke... you want a Coke?

dialogues.text: Aw, you don't love me...                               * And as Phillip smiles and wipe his chin.

dialogues.text: With Phillip I felt strong. I felt invincible. I promised myself he would never want for anything ever again. That meant I needed a real job. Something dependable. And- no more scams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bored Steven waits in the middle of a big wig's office. He looks at PHOTOS on a nearby wall of a broad-shouldered all-American man dressed in a NASA jump suit performing various astronautical training tasks. He picks up a small ASTRONAUT FIGURINE and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you waiting Steven. Steven turns to find Dan Lindholm, the broad-shouldered man himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dan Lindholm. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08 STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you a spaceman? LINDHOLM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Never got out there though. NASA's a real political place. Never could figure out whose ass to kiss to get a mission. (then) All in the past. Barely even think about it now... CUT TO REVEAL a HUGE MODEL of the SPACE SHUTTLE that engulfs half the room. Steven puts the figurine back. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spaceman, huh? How do you crap up there? LINDHOLM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ass gasket. (draws on his coffee) Have a seat. Steven sits across the desk from Lindholm . LINDHOLM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the popularity of HMO's in today's health care system, doctors need help managing their billing-- so they can focus on their patients. That's where USA Medical Management comes in. Hundreds of millions of dollars pass through our system from the HMO's to the doctors. It's a critical business. A powerful business... (beat) So when I read your resume, I wasn't sure what to think. Your level of education and your past experience would factor heavily into this decision and frankly... Steven deflates in expectation. LINDHOLM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you were head and shoulders above the rest. I mean, I could hardly believe it. But when I called your references-- well they couldn't speak more highly of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven makes breakfast in his tightie-whities while talking on the phone. Phillip is in the background doing a crossword puzzle at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could not speak more highly of Steven Russell, Mr. Lindholm . A real straight shooter. We were damn lucky to have him at Prudential as long as we did. In his own world, Phillip chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brando's wet debut? Steven covers the phone with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the Waterfront.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan continues to wax on about Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Employee of the year two years running? Developing software with IBM? You're the kind of people we need here Steven. We want you as our Chief Financial Officer. So what do you say? I want your answer right now. C'mon Steven- let's light this candle. As Steven pretends to mull--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uptight assistant (RHEBA) leads Steven into his fancy new office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...for example "he's in a meeting" sounds better than "he's away from his desk" at least I think so, but whatever you prefer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine... sure. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages    5-23-08   62 She leads him to his new desk which is stacked with folders, files, printouts and reams of data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pulled all the claims for the last two years as well as the statements, transfers and confirmations from the bank. Most of it's routine and I think you can get up to speed in a day or two. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else I can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh.... cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it today but I don't do that really. Steven nods and turns his attention to the sea of numbers before him. He looks concerned as he begins to leaf through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven sits in a board meeting, surrounded by all of the company honchos. Dan Lindholm lords over the gathering at the head of the table while a suit (MARK) reads from a report to the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossover from traditional markets shows declination and inverse diffusion seems commensurate with net-trade trending. HMO penetration still leads PPO, NMO and FMO as usual but attenuation is growing more prevalent in Q4 as projected... As for Q3, well Q3 is what Q3 always is: Q2 with training wheels. Everyone LAUGHS, but no one quite as hard as Steven who desperately tries to fit in. Larry Birkheim, the CEO of USAMM sits beside Dan Lindholm. He chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Steven, your turn. I know you've only had the one quarter to play catch up but I tell you, we can't wait to get some insight here. "I Love You Phillip Morris"      Green Pages    5-23-08 STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. What about? BIRKHEIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark's projections. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hm.   Sure. BIRKHEIM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seem kind of flat. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   Okay. Ummm... Steven fumbles through some folders and vamps a while. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I did a lot of work here and uh... I think maybe... well I could just read it to you but uh... it might be better to just uh... The group looks at him quizzically.     Just as it seems Steven has been up to nothing-- STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll just show you. Todd? TODD, an incredibly hot assistant unveils an easel full of detailed tables. Steven walks the board through an incredibly well prepared presentation. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you look here at Mark's projections again for Q3, you'll see- well you'll see they're just that- projections. Projections based on a model set by my predecessor. I decided to reject that model and do things a little differently. I want to show you my results. This is what we actually made in Q3-- Todd flips to the next card. The graphs GROW exponentially. The group is intrigued. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now let me tell you how I did it... Todd unveils another card, the men are impressed by the unseen image. And as Steven explains himself, Dan and Birkheim smile broadly and turn to each other with smug assurance. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a candy wrapper opening. A hand removes the candy revealing an INSPIRING MESSAGE printed inside the wrapper- "When two hearts race, both win." ON PHILLIP. He's deeply touched by the sentiment as he chews on the candy. He puts the wrapper on the REFRIGERATOR with a MAGNET. He opens ANOTHER. He chews and reads- "Commit random acts of kindness" Again he's touched and puts it on the refrigerator. He opens ANOTHER and pops the candy in his mouth.    He reads- "A smile is a flower on your face" He's disgusted by the trite sentiment and THROWS THE WRAPPER IN THE TRASH. A beat later, he REMOVES THE CANDY from his mouth and THROWS THAT IN THE TRASH TOO. Just then Steven walks by in a TUXEDO, adjusting his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tux? Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a work thing. Were we supposed to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No- I just thought- it's fine. Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some stupid gala ball thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gala? Oh... (playing it off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I'll be home early.   Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black-tie cocktail party is in full swing. Steven eats a canap by a window. Something outside catches his eye. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Lindholm is out on the balcony staring up at the starry sky. Steven approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that? Dan points out a small dot of light moving across the sky. Steven squints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh- is it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Probably deploying the arm right now. Just a satellite deployment. Nothing special... Just touching the face of God. He chokes back a tear, then throws an arm around Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Lindholm escorts Steven to BEVERLY Lindholm and a ghastly gaggle of Texas society WIVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev- Ladies- I want you to meet Steven Russell, our CFO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I heard about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good things I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and no. Don's bellyaching about how big your Christmas bonus is gonna be because you're making him so much money. A GIGGLE infects the group. Another WIFE speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you married Steven? "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well where is she, sweetheart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She works. Travels a lot.     It's killing her she couldn't be here. And as the wives fret symathetically-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven saunters over to VERA the company accountant who is stamping some checks. He places some papers on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are ready for Dan ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Steven. You doin' good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of. I just got back from my lawyer's office. I asked him, "What's your fee?" He says, "I charge $50 for three questions." So I ask, "Don't you think that's a little expensive?" And he says, "Yes it is... Now what's your final question?" Vera EXPLODES with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so true. Lawyers! She turns to a colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! Come here, you gotta hear this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven sits at a high powered lunch with Dan Lindholm and Larry Birkheim. He is diligently taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the thing about the back nine at Pebble Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08   6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care what your handicap is... that sand wedge is gonna get a workout-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree with you more. I remember one time, I was at Augusta... As Dan prattles on, Steven continues to write on his pad. CUT TO REVEAL he's doodling pictures of SMILEY- FACED PENISES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven refills his mug of coffee while in the background, two SECRETARIES dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman says,"That's awful expensive, isn't it?" and the lawyer says, "Yes and now you only got one question left!" She laughs LOUDER than the woman listening to the joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause he already asked the two! They both laugh loudly now as Steven exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven and Dan Lindholm stand at the omelette station at a high class brunch buffet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cook)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mushroom and cheese. (to Steven)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway like I was saying the Northrup guy says to the NASA "well that question's gonna cost fifty million to answer" so NASA says, "Don't you think that's a lot of money?" and Northrup says "Yep, now you owe us another fifty million. Next question please!" This sounds eerily familiar. Steven laughs a COURTESY LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah that's a good one... "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why there's so few shuttle missions. They're wasting all their money on bureaucracy. And probes... Unmanned probes. (then)

dialogues.text: Like people care if there's life on Mars. (to cook)

dialogues.text: I'm trying to be understanding here honey, but golf? Why not just eat pussy?

dialogues.text: Oh! This is easy! (cocky, Butch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a hazard ain't it Steven? Eventually, a ball flies out of the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to ball)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! How ya like that, sister!?

dialogues.text: Steven and the Client amble along a few yards behind Dan and the other client. Steven is covered in sweat and sand.

dialogues.text: So the black fella says to the jew lawyer- "50 bucks a question? Ain't that expensive?" "Yeah it's expensive," he says, "I'm a Jew, you nigger!" The man laughs to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it?!! He soon spots his ball up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I am. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08 He moves on, leaving Steven standing there, disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven sits at his desk, detached and fed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was because it's just my nature, or maybe it was because of my past... or maybe it was because they were the most boring fucking people I'd ever met in my life... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever the reason, I had been robbing them blind for months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else I can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh.... cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it today but I don't do that really. Steven nods and begins to leaf through various folders. It isn't long before something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS of Steven researching by leafing through folders and files INTERCUT with a slow push in on a CHECK PRINTING MACHINE as it spits out product as well as TIME LAPSE footage of employees buzzing through one of the USAM hallways.

dialogues.text: The thing about U-SAMM was that they took in all this HMO money and distributed it to doctors.

dialogues.text: But in the time between receiving the money and paying it out- it was just sitting there, not making interest or anything.

dialogues.text: At his desk, Steven leafs through the company finances.

dialogues.text: It occurred to me to set up an investment account where the held money would earn interest for the short time that the company had it. We're talking twenty two million at any given time here, so even short term the interest adds up pretty quickly. I'd be making the company millions virtually overnight. He leans back to think to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I of course would take a commission. Say... fifty percent. The only problem with that was-- I wasn't the one signing the checks.

dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a check being signature-stamped with a RUBBER STAMP. A hand places the stamp into a small wooden box and closes it. CUT WIDE to reveal the hand belongs to VERA, the company accountant and STEVEN is standing over her. It is now we realize we are revisiting an earlier scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I ask, "Don't you think that's a little expensive?" and the lawyer says, "Yes it is, now what's your final question?" Vera EXPLODES with laughter.

dialogues.text: It's so true. Lawyers! She turns to a colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie! Come here, you gotta hear this! "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08 And as ANNIE comes over, Steven's hand moves to the wooden box and secretly plucks the RUBBER STAMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lindholm raps on the open door as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven, we got a problem. Vera lost that stupid rubber stamp again. Her office is a goddamned disaster and she's the o-ring if you know what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faux)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... how long till we can get a new one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Time to overhaul the program. I got a computerized system already on order. No more room for pilot error. Steven hangs his head, visibly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be up and running in a couple months. I want you signing the checks until then. Steven brightens up suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?! Great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You play golf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh... yeah. Sure.

dialogues.text: A huge MOVING TRUCK is parked before an impressive house in an upscale neighborhood. MOVERS unload and roll dollies past two matching MERCEDES COUPES. Steven and Phillip oversee the work- each holding matching MINIATURE PINCERS. They smile wide.   Moments later an OFFSCREEN HONK gets their attention. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   7 They look to see a SPORTING GOODS TRUCK pulling up with two JET-SKIS hitched to a trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wowed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big was this Christmas bonus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty big.

dialogues.text: The sheriff is desperate and goes to a psychic. All the woman says is rabbit. Rabbit-rabbit-rabbit, that's all. Well he thinks `bullshit' and he's driving back home and what happens? dialogues.text: Yeah... they can find out all sorts of stuff, those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm... "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can find out anything about anyone... anything. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They could even find out something about you... Steven grows suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip... what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just-- Is something going on? Something you're not telling me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if there is, stop now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't.    There's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about the money, the house, jet-skis- all I want is you. I just want us to be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're always going to be together. And there is nothing going on. I promise. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't lie to you, baby. Steven stares back and convinces Phillip with a look. They kiss.
