dialogues.text: Birkheim emerges from his parked MERCEDES C-CLASS. After locking it he notices a little smudge and buffs it out with his handkerchief. As he admires his car proudly, the building volume of the MIAMI SOUND MACHINE gets his attention. He sees as Steven arrives in his NEW and MUCH MORE IMPRESSIVE SL500 and parks a few spots down. "I Love You Phillip Morris"        Green Pages   5-23-08 He watches as Steven tries on several watches and tosses them back in the glove compartment before settling on one and exiting the car. Birkheim raises a brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birkheim and Steven share the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SL.   That the C you're driving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good value. DING! The door opens. Steven exits, leaving a disgruntled Birkheim in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birkheim pores over spreadsheets, taking notes and comparing numbers. CLOSE UPS on headings like "INTEREST EARNED" and "DEPOSIT" indicate he's looking for something He continues to make notes, growing ever more suspicious until something catches his eye. In the margin of one of the pages is a DOODLING of a SMILEY-FACED PENIS. Birkheim doesn't quite know what to make of this... but it seems to stare at him mockingly. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven whistles happily and takes a draw off his coffee mug. As he passes an office, something catches his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some questions about these new accounts we've opened. Steven slows to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birkheim, his back to the door, is on the phone as Steven eavesdrops outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I was wondering if we could compare some numbers. I know you usually talk to our CFO but this is a delicate matter and I'd like keep it secret for now. Steven is worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on blank copies spitting out of a copier. Steven stands over the machine, his finger on the button as he keeps surveillance on Birkheim's office door. A SECRETARY arrives with a stack of papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Mister Ru--

dialogues.speaker: I'M MAKING COPIES
dialogues.text: She leaves, terrified. Finally, Steven spots Birkheim leaving his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven runs into Birkheim's office and scans the papers on his desk. Nothing. He turns his attention to Birkheim's briefcase, but he can't get it open. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages    5-23-08 Eventually he spots a blank legal pad and looks at it closely. He grabs a pencil and does the old detective trick of shading in the page to reveal what was written on the now missing page above. The embossed text reads, "837,502.12" He stares at it a moment. This number looks familiar. He grabs the phone and dials. An AUTOMATED VOICE answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, you've reached the Automatic Teller at Texas Commerce Bank. Please enter your personal account number followed by the pound sign. Steven quickly enters some numbers. As he listens he flips through Birkheim's desktop calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Your account balance is eight hundred-thirty seven thousand five hundred and two dollars and twelve cents. To repeat this- It's the SAME NUMBER as on the pad. He hangs up. And turns his attention to the calendar. He spies an entry that reads, "Harris County Police, 12:30" He leaps out of the chair and exits the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven furiously shreds documents in the company's PAPER SHREDDER. Moments later the same SECRETARY enters the room with an armload of work- enraging Steven.

dialogues.speaker: CAN'T YOU SEE I'M SHREDDING
dialogues.text: Terrified, the woman runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on an ATM keypad as Steven punches some keys and retrieves a handful of cash. He stuffs it into his breast pocket and hops back into his SL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS. Debbie answers. "I Love You Phillip Morris"      Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT. Steven is on the phone while driving with the top down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How's Steffie doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Real good. She sure is your daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's interested in boys already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha-ha.   How's Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's good. He says hi, but listen- I just wanted to call and let you know I'm switching all my phone numbers. I'll let you know when we get a new one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Steven, are you on the lam again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb, you always knew me best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven you really should stop all this, you are such a good man and I know that Jesus has a plan for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe this is his plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't start. A CALL-WAITING TONE is heard. "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway Debbie- that's my boss calling. I love you both and I'll call you soon. Steven clicks over to the other line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT with Lindholm on the phone, with Birkheim in the background, spreadsheets in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gulf Freeway. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the office. You coming back anytime soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we just want to see you Steven. We miss you is what it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice Dan. But I don't think I'm coming back in. I think we both know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about that Steven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye-bye Dan. Steven hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven storms into the house, panting. A worried Phillip comes to greet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People keep calling, what's going on? "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08 Steven starts pulling wads of money out of every available pocket and piling it on the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Thought we'd take a little vacation. Key West. Let's pack. Quick! Okay I'll pack for you! Phillip follows him through the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucking knew it- you did do something. You lied to me! You looked me right in the eye and lied!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't get angry, it's gonna be fun, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you going back to jail? Steven, you promised we'd always be together!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we are! We're never gonna be apart. Never. Steven ducks into the bedroom.   Phillip doesn't follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lying son of a bitch! You took advantage of me! Just like all the rest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven furiously packs a suitcase, yelling out to Phillip in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get a place. Do some fishing. I can work on my key lime pie recipe... Steven picks up the suitcase without zipping it up and heads back into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I might even grow a beard and enter the Papa Hemingway contest! He stops short in the hallway.   Phillip is gone. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip? Honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven bursts from the house still clutching the suitcase just in time to see Phillip's car rounding the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He re-enters, emptying the suitcase along the way. He then proceeds to fill it with the cash on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven exits and heads for his car, but before he can get in- WHAM! He's grabbed by a group of POLICEMEN. He SQUEALS like a rabbit's death bleat and flails wildly. This continues for a while until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven resumes his VOICE OVER in the penitentiary infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There I was, keeping secrets, living a lie. Like I said, I tend to do that. Now I didn't blame Phillip for running out on me, but I had to make things right. I had to get him back. You see, there's something I didn't tell you... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...it's about my old boyfriend. Do you remember him? His name was Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"        Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Florida sun bathes the bedroom in a heavenly glow, illuminating Jimmy Kemple as he wakes. He opens his eyes to see Steven staring longingly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kemple smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only been a month, Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fall for me Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the hell not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven thinks a moment, but never stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. We're back at the scene where Steven tries to jump in the dumpster. He leaps over the guard rail and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVEN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!!! Steven hits the ground next to the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages    5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short time later, Steven lies MOANING and delirious. Kemple cradles his head as Debbie and the cop watch nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to do the time. I'll wait for you. I will. I'll wait for you. I promise. I love you. I'll wait for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven pushes a cart of food through the block delivering sandwiches to fellow detainees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on fingers dialing a pay phone.    Cut wide to reveal it's Steven making a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi baby. What do you mean? It's noon. I always call at noon. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's prison honey, it sucks. But I'm getting used to it. What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kemple, on the phone at his mother's home, is INTERCUT. He looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really sick. You haven't seen me in a year. You don't know. I just came back from the doctor. My T-cells are... He begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you have to go to jail? How could you do this to me? "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08   8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am. Who knows how long I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna die alone, okay?   Just believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. I promise. He hangs up, tortured by this news. His eyes catch a glimpse of a DETECTIVE exiting the cell block, banging on the GUARD BOOTH glass with his walkie-talkie. He just stares at the door, long and hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven approaches a section of bars where a BLONDE INMATE is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get `em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The inmate looks around then shoves a BALL OF CLOTHES through the bars. Steven gives a look. Something upsets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all I could get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in prison orange, Steven walks up to a counter, a sandwiches in hand. He holds it up before a HUGE GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lunch is served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Guard goes through the bag, Steven reaches over the counter and swipes a WALKIE TALKIE- revealing a CALENDAR that reads FRIDAY the 13th. He beats a nervous exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a MAN'S ASS IN RUBY RED, SKIN TIGHT HOTPANTS. CUT TO REVEAL Steven walking nervously down the hall clad in said hotpants as well as a tight spaghetti strap top. Walkie Talkie in hand, he tries to give as authoritative an aura as he can. He gets to a glass security door, where two JAIL GUARDS stand. Steven taps on the glass confidently with the WALKIE TALKIE and signals them to open the door. They do.   And as he passes the two guards one of them speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking head) Undercover vice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven approaches another set of doors and signals. doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven   passes through the doors and comes to an exit. H pushes   on it to find it LOCKED. Panic sets in as he pushes   repeatedly to no avail. And just when he thinks all is   lost-- He looks down to realizes he's neglected to notice the PUSH BAR to open the door. And with a gentle PUSH, the door OPENS ...and he's gone. "I Love You Phillip Morris"      Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HELEN KEMPLE brings a tray of toast and water into the bedroom where Steven sits over Kemple's rapidly deteriorating body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Mom. She kisses both Jimmy and Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in the other room. She exits. Steven tries to give Kemple some water. Kemple resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. You need to drink something. Kemple meekly hands Steven his stainless steel ROLEX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to have this because I'm gonna be leaving soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's not okay with me baby. You can't leave. I need you around here. You're the love of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sweet... but no, I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. I've seen him. You haven't met him yet, but you will... Steven is perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be so happy. And I know you don't think so, but you deserve to be happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not thinking clearly baby. "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am... And you have to promise me... When you find him, you're gonna treat him right... okay? Steven gives in gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.     Now drink some water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treat him right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is on the couch, watching the TV news as OJ Simpson is apprehended. It isn't long before a KNOCK on the door gets her attention. She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it? She reaches for the door and-- SMASH!! The door bursts open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven is dragged kicking and SCREAMING to a squad car by a group of POLICEMEN.

dialogues.speaker: WOULDN'T DIE ALONE
dialogues.text: And as he futilely fights--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLAXON BLARES and the cell door slides OPEN with metallic ROAR, revealing a very impatient Steven with a few days stubble on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about damn time! He rushes out. "I Love You Phillip Morris"      Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven hurries to the phone and dials. He nervously awaits an answer. Then-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Helen it's me. Is-- He's interrupted and proceeds to listen.       The look o face says it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... mmm hmm... Through the glass wall outside the phone room, we watch as Steven continues to absorb the bad news. He hangs up the phone and falls to pieces as the CACOPHONY of the prison masks any sound of his grief.

dialogues.speaker: I/E NEW HOUSE, 1996
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE ON the stainless steel ROLEX. WE'RE BACK outside Steven and Phillip's house in a POLICE CRUISER. Steven stares at it, reflecting on his memory of Kemple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't tell you before. I just don't like talking about some things. The door opens and a HOUSTON COP hands him a black LEATHERETTE CASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This what you wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diabetes huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... The cop gets in and they drive off. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOUSTON COP and a DRIVING COP ride up front, not paying much attention to their passenger. In the REAR, Steven nervously and quietly prepares an INSULIN SYRINGE and inexpertly INJECTS IT in his belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't going to lose Phillip. No way. I broke Jimmy's heart and I was not gonna break Phillip's. I was gonna make everything alright. No matter what it took, I was going to escape. He gives a quick look around and prepares another syringe. After another injection, he prepares another. And then ANOTHER and ANOTHER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVING COP watches the road blankly until his nose catches a putrid scent in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck... what is that? The other cop smells it too. They begin to look around. The Driving Cop glances back to see Steven CONVULSING AND FROTHING AT THE MOUTH like a rabid bobble head doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! They turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh! He shit himself! Get us to the hospital! The SIREN WAILS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven wakes up in a hospital bed. A little bleary at first, his eyes scan the room. He's alone. He sits up, pleased and very excited. He pulls out his IV, hops out of bed and heads for the window when- "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages    5-23-08 CLANG! He stops short to find his ankle is shackled to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! The door opens and the Houston Cop peers his head in. He looks back to his unseen partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three manacled PRISONERS, one of them Steven, follow a CORRECTIONS OFFICER into the Processing Area at the Harris County Jail. Each of the men are still in their street clothes and manacled separately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat. They take a seat on a bench outside a large steel door as the officer talks to a PROCESSING CLERK. Steven is visibly agitated and ignores the other men on the bench with him. The FIRST PRISONER turns to the SECOND PRISONER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they get you for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand Theft.    You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B and E. The Second Prisoner turns to Steven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you? ...but STEVEN IS GONE.   The man looks around. Across the room, Steven stands in an elevator amidst a group of lackadaisical JANITORS, clutching a mop. The prisoner watches in awe as the doors CLOSE. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors OPEN to reveal Steven, not with the janitors, but with a GROUP OF OFFICERS-- re-emerging from the elevator and back into the processing area. The LEAD OFFICER talks to the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This slippery son of a bitch is going straight to lockup. Steven heaves a sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven, in a fresh prison jumpsuit, paces while talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Phillip, pick up, it's me.    I'm sorry. C'mon. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit! He hangs up.   A nearby inmate chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long. (picks up phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hit me in the face with this? And off the inmate's quizzened expression--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on Steven's BLOODY FACE. A PRISON PHYSICIAN is examining it closely. We notice Steven is wearing WHITE SCRUBS (as opposed to the doctor who wears GREEN SCRUBS).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a pretty big gash. Just stay still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure hurts... "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages   5-23-08 As Steven talks and the doctor looks, Steven stealthily plucks the doctor's ID BADGE and slips it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven finishes filling the sink in his cell and pulls out a GREEN MAGIC MARKER. He breaks it open and drips the ink into the water. And as the water turns GREEN, Steven removes his white scrubs and plunges them in the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NIGHT GUARD watches his monitors when a rap on the glass gets his attention. He looks up to see Steven in newly (and badly) dyed GREEN SCRUBS, awaiting exit on the other side, holding the stolen ID BADGE against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `night Doc. He pushes the buzzer and Steven pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven State and Local police cruisers sit in the parking lot, a shirtless Steven is removed from his motel room by a pair of OFFICERS. His skin is stained green but his expression is pure resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on a GAVEL striking. Steven stands before the judge flanked by his attorney and a bailiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set bail at 900,000 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine hundred thousand!? It's a white collar charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor- "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages     5-23-08 The judge begins FILLING OUT A FORM. He barely looks up at them. HOUSTON JUDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Russell is a flight risk. The bond is set. Nine hundred thousand. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit. (sotto to attorney) Set a reduction hearing. ATTORNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off this) Your honor we'd like to set a reduction hearing. HOUSTON JUDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your right, but I strongly advise you don't. The judge finishes filling out the form and PLACES IT AT THE EDGE OF HIS BENCH for Steven to see. It clearly reads his bail amount, his charge, everything. As the Attorney PRATTLES ON in the background, Steven just STARES AT THE FORM LONG AND HARD. HOUSTON JUDGE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You can have your hearing tomorrow. Steven interjects. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Lawyer) Next week. The attorney looks at him quizzically and turns back to the judge. ATTORNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like next week if that's okay. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) On the thirteenth. ATTORNEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh the thirteenth if possible. HOUSTON JUDGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Friday the thirteenth. Now go away. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A block of holding cells well stocked with men waiting on the legal system. We soon come upon Steven who is furiously SKETCHING OUT A COPY of the form from the judge's bench from memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on an opened envelope next to Steven's sketch and a letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dearest Tyler. Long time no talk. I won't beat around the bush. I got into a spot of trouble here in Houston and find myself needing help. That's right, jail again. Anyway I was wondering if you could type up this thing for me on your computer just like I sketched out... As Steven `reads' the letter we reveal a MAN hacking away on a computer nearby. As we move closer, we see that he's the MOUSTACHED MAN from the night of his car crash and he's not wearing pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven opens a letter and pulls out the FORGED FORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! He grabs a pen and begins filling it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manacled to a line of prisoners, Steven shuffles through a crowded hallway. Courthouse staff are everywhere. Steven spots a HARRIED woman approaching with an armful of paperwork. He reaches into his jumpsuit and pulls out the FORGED DOCUMENT and as she passes- HE DROPS IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am?! The woman turns back, annoyed. "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropped something. She picks it up and puts it on her pile. He smiles as he watches her walk away.

dialogues.speaker: INT. HARRIS COUNTY JAIL PHONE BANK, 1996- DAY
dialogues.text: Steven dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT, a CLERK answers her RINGING PHONE.    Her desk CALENDAR reads: "September, Friday the 13th"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Julie. Steven puts on his best SOUTHERN BELLE VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as woman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I have Judge Charles Hearn for the clerk's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll put him through. Steven switches to an authoritative JUDGE VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gruff)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the clerk's office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Hearn- I got a bail adjustment coming through, sent it over today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing. What's the name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russell. Steven Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it right here. "I Love You Phillip Morris"      Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I need that to go through right away. Because if it don't, I'm gonna have to chug about a quart of Tidee Bowl on account of all the shit I'll be eating. Know what I mean? Julie GIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And say- Julie? Can you save me a dime and connect me to a good bail bondsman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LIMOUSINE pulls up outside a modest Galveston house. The CHAUFFEUR opens the door and Steven emerges dressed in new linen suit and clutching champagne and flowers. He approaches the door and just as he's about to knock--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away Steven! Steven is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I didn't know you were coming!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here! I'm done with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They probably have a psychic after you right now! Did you see any bunnies!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, I know you're upset- but we love each other. "I Love You Phillip Morris"       Green Pages   5-23-08 PHILLIP (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You opened a bank account for Doctor Phillip Morris! Now they think I'm in on everything! I'm facing real time! You know I can't go back to prison. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about that- they weren't supposed to find that. It was for your own good. So we could be together. PHILLIP (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off! I'm in enough trouble. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Phillip, just trust me- PHILLIP (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK YOU YOU FUCKING LIAR! Do you realize how bad you've fucked me over!! You made me an accomplice! You fucking liar! I don't want to see you. Go away! I never want to see you again! STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip don't say that. No response. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what am I supposed to do? PHILLIP (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the lawyer, you figure it out. This time, it's Steven who remains silent. PHILLIP (O.S.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... THE DOOR SWINGS OPEN, revealing a SEETHING PHILLIP. PHILLIP (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even a lawyer?! You fucking liar! STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... He slams the door shut again. PHILLIP (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?! Who the hell are you!? "I Love You Phillip Morris"         Green Pages   5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Steven walks up to the door and pleads gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door. Just open the door. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door. Please. I just want to say one thing. Please. Just one thing. That's all. Please. A long silence. Steven waits longer than he should with the certainty that it will open. And eventually it does... slowly and tentatively. Through the screen door, their eyes are just inches apart. Steven looks into Phillip's soul. He opens his mouth and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down on the ground faggots!! Steven and Phillip are shocked to see a small SWAT team surrounding the front porch with automatic weapons.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN
dialogues.text: And as they comply and the armed men descend--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven and Phillip sit manacled, side by side. They stare at the floor in miserable uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. No response. Phillip can only sit and stew.       And ste Until finally, he's had enough. "I Love You Phillip Morris"     Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the moment we met, you've done nothing but lie. Our whole relationship... just lies. I'm such an asshole. You took advantage of me- just like all the rest of them. You were supposed to protect me- but you've done nothing but make a fool of me. And you expect me to love you? How can I love you? I don't even know who you are. And you know what's sad? I don't even think you know who you are. So how am I supposed to love something that don't even exist? You tell me. Eventually a POLICEMAN stands before Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris.     You're up. Before he stands up, Phillip manages a terse statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never forgive you Steven. Never. Steven is speechless as he watches Phillip walk away- disappearing down a long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the last time I ever saw him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP carries his belongings past a line of hulking, cat-calling convicts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...But I knew he was right. Phillip, Jimmy, Debbie- they've all been right. My whole life was nothing but a bunch of lies. Lies to make people love me, lies to keep them from leaving me and lies to make them give me their money. He enters his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven carries his belongings to his new cell in Michael Unit. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08   1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the process I lost track of who I was. Maybe Barbra Bascombe had me pegged right from the beginning and that's why she gave me up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven stares at his distorted face in the polished metal MIRROR in his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever the case, how does a person who doesn't exist go on existing? Well the answer is- he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven is curled up in a ball in his cell, SOBBING as he stares at a SNAPSHOT of Phillip in Key West pasted to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, I'm trying to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven sits over an untouched tray of food, staring at it detached. He looks thin. Pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven kneels over the toilet in his cell.   The sound of PUKING reverberates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Months later, Steven sits up in his bed. He now has a grey beard and with his shirt off we can see he has lost an unhealthy amount of weight. "I Love You Phillip Morris"    Green Pages    5-23-08   1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN CLOSE on the gaunt and grey-skinned Steven. A MALE NURSE places a thermometer in his mouth and looks at Steven's medical history. He looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven sits before a YOUNG PRISON DOCTOR who looks through his records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to have to tell you this Steven, your t-cell counts indicate that, uh... Well... you have AIDS. Steven sits expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do I have? And off the Doctor's grave face--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOUDS drift slowly across the sky. The OPENING SCENE again- the four kids lying on the hill, staring at the clouds. Young Steven smiles at the sight. A dull WHINE is heard, building until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first hospital scene in the movie. The cardio ALARM blares. Steven watches from his bed as a DOCTOR appears and pushes the nurses aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the crash cart!? He straddles the patient's chest and pushes down hard- the sound of a sternum CRACKING can be heard. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here we are, where you first met me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheet is pulled over the cardio victim's corpse and Steven watches as it is wheeled out of the ward. He returns his bleary gaze to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in this bed for months now. Waiting to die. The only thing that keeps me going is the thought that I might get a chance to see Phillip one more time. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know how much longer I can do this... Steven's eyes roll back into his head as he slips into unconsciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slightly built, effeminate inmate (SAMUEL) raps on Phillip's open cell door as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuel.   You want some crackers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... thanks. Look- I just talked to my friend- he's a nurse at the infirmary. I don't know if you know this or not but uh... Phillip looks to him with curiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip flails as GUARDS hold him back from a DOCTOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LET ME IN!   Just let me in! "I Love You Phillip Morris"    Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you he's not here! You need to calm down. Phillip calms himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me where he is. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slipped into a coma for a few days. He's conscious now, but he's very sick. We had him transferred to a private care facility. There was nothing we could do for him here. It's just a matter of time now. Phillip listens in devastated silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven looks worse than ever in his semi-private bed, looking out the window at the clouds with a catatonic gaze. He's at peace. It is the moment of his death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven? Death will have to wait another few moments.    A nurse leans over him as he tries to focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven? Someone wants to talk to you. He keeps calling. He's driving us crazy. Steven can't respond.    The nurse picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay you can put him through. She puts the phone to Steven's ear. He can muster only a few words. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wisp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to find out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is INTERCUT with the helpless Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven. Oh God... Why didn't you write me? I don't know how this happened, they say I'm fine. Oh God, who did this? (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. I had to talk to you Steven. (tearing up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am still angry with you, but I need you to know something. Even if sometimes I don't know who you are, I love you. I never stopped loving you. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me are just fools for love I guess- written in the stars or some crap like that. (tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was never better, never more real than with you Steven. I realize now that all that crazy shit you did- in your fucked up way- it was always for me. Always for us. You are the most amazing man Steven. It takes my breath away. And even though I can't be with you now, I will always be yours... Forever. He steels himself as best he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if you have to go, go. It's okay. I'm right there. Okay? I'm right there. Tears surface again.   He chokes back a sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a single tear runs down Steven's face, the nurse puts the phone on the hook and leaves. Steven lies motionless.   He gazes out the window to the passing clouds in the sky. It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuel walks past cell after cell with a grave look in his eyes. Eventually he arrives at Phillip's cell to find him sitting on his bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip...? Phillip looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh- my friend in the infirmary... Uh, they got a call from that long term care place and uh, well a few days ago Steven- (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I'm so sorry Phillip. Phillip nods as it washes over him. He sends Samuel on his way with a look. Once he's alone, Phillip lets go and SOBS. He buries his face in his pillow. After a long while- CLANG. A sound gets his attention.    A BOSSY GUARD stand at the door of his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris.   Come with me. Phillip composes himself and follows the guard out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard leads Phillip down the corridor. Still coming out of his mournful haze, he becomes curious. They arrive at a door marked, "MEETING ROOM 2".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your lawyer's here. He swings open the door to reveal STEVEN, alive and well and wearing a thrift store suit. Phillip is aghast, frozen. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I forget to mention I didn't die? Yeah, I didn't die. Faked the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Steven is curled up in a ball, sobbing as he stares at a picture of Phillip pasted to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up, I'm trying to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I got a broken heart here. We see now his Bunkmate is Cleavon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then do something about it mother fucker- `stead of crying like Whitney Houston looking for her crack pipe. Steven takes his kind words to heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn right. Love creates miracles motherfucker. Ain't you ever read the Bible? So get off your ass and go forth unto the Canaanites you faggot bitch. Steven returns his gaze to Phillip's photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you're right you're right Cleavon... Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna suck me off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well sweet dreams then. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages       5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying there in all my misery, I had a moment of clarity. It became clear to me- I had to get to Phillip. No matter what. Even if it meant dying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Steven sits over an untouched tray of food, staring at it detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faking your death from AIDS is no easy task, believe me. But after watching Jimmy die, I thought I could make it convincing. First, you have to starve yourself- I ate half as much every day for ten months. After that, you have to fake all sorts of symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Steven kneels over the toilet in his cell, sticking his finger down his throat until he pukes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta keep this up for months until you lose about, say, 80 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Months later, Steven sits up in his bed. He now has a grey beard and with his shirt off we can see he has lost an unhealthy amount of weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the hardest part is falsifying your records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven enters an inmate's cell (LAWRENCE) with a BIG BAG OF COFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Lawrence- you still work in the infirmary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm... "I Love You Phillip Morris"    Green Pages      5-23-08 Steven holds up a three pound BAG OF COFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence sweeps up in an empty office. He looks to see if the coast is clear and bolts for some file cabinets. After some searching, Lawrence pulls out a file entitled "Russell, Steven A". Reading from a scrap of paper, he scrawls something with a pen. Lawrence then reaches into his pants and pulls out some forged forms- stuffing them into the folder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. OPEN CLOSE on the gaunt and grey-skinned Steven. A MALE NURSE places a thermometer in his mouth and looks at Phillip's medical history. CLOSE ON THE FILE- a doctor's entry reads "HIV+ since 91" A few flips of the pages reveal FORGED BLOOD TEST DOCUMENTS. Buzzwords like T-CELL COUNTS and other terms catch the Nurse's eye. He looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Steven sits before a YOUNG PRISON DOCTOR who looks through his records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you have AIDS. Steven sits expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do I have? And off the Doctor's grave face-- "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven lays in his hospital bed. A FAT NURSE puts a pill in his mouth and follows it with some water. She exits. Once she's clear, Steven reaches into his mouth and pulls out the pill. He secretly places it into a small HOLE in his mattress for safe keeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHBACK. Again, we are at the first hospital scene of the movie. The cardio ALARM blares. Steven watches as a DOCTOR appears and pushes the nurses aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the crash cart!? He straddles the patient's chest and pushes down hard- the sound of a sternum CRACKING can be heard. With the staff distracted, Steven reaches into his mattress hole and pulls out scores of pills. He stuffs them into his mouth as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the hardest part by far is getting transferred to a private care facility. It's standard procedure for late stage patients, but convincing them I was about to die would involve taking a few risks. He chases the pills down with a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven is helped from a corrections van into a wheelchair outside the Restful Acres facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a four day coma, they were convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his bed at the care facility, Steven looks around and picks up the phone. He talks with a FOREIGN ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Doctor Rios from the Hamblin Center, Houston. I'm looking for AIDS patients for a study we're... "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages      5-23-08 And as he talks--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once I got settled in, I just called the Department of Corrections and convinced them I was a state-sponsored doctor looking for late stage AIDS patients for an experimental treatment. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As luck would have it, they had one patient that was eligible... Steven continues his Dr. Rios imitation on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you do? Steven Russell? Could you spell that? CAMERA SETTLES on a nearby CALENDAR.    It reads: "MONDAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The calendar reads "FRIDAY, MARCH 13"    An ORDERLY enter with a WHEELCHAIR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Russell, the clinic sent a taxi here to pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. RESTFUL ACRES CARE CENTER, 1998
dialogues.text: Later that day, Steven is helped out of his wheelchair into a waiting taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for all that time- all those doctors, all those nurses and all those facilities... not one of them ever thought to give me an AIDS test... The door SLAMS and off he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Texas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once clear, Steven speaks to the driver. "I Love You Phillip Morris"    Green Pages      5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a special request when I ordered the cab. Did they tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah- right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts a GREASY BROWN BAG into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven grabs it and begins to gorge himself on BURGERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week later, the hospice was to get a call from Doctor Rios, telling them Steven Russell had died undergoing treatment. And after all that hard work dying? Where's the first place I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO MEETING ROOM. Phillip stands frozen before Steven

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard pushes Phillip past the threshold.    The door SLAMS SHUT behind him. He staggers toward Steven as a kaleidoscope of emotions plays across his face. Bewilderment, relief, sorrow, joy and finally, anger- WHACK!   He slaps Steven across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know- I'm sorry- You weren't supposed to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't take a chance telling you. You know that. I couldn't. But Phillip, I only did it so I could get here to you. (then) Just to talk to you. And here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages        5-23-08 Phillip tries to take this to heart. After a moment... PHILLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so skinny. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Just hungry. PHILLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven I don't- STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Listen. I just came here to tell you one thing and that's it. You don't have to take me back, I just want to say one thing. Phillip is listening. STEVEN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you thought we were nothing but a lie- but underneath all those lies there was always something that was real. I thought about what you said to me. You said you don't know who I am. But I have to tell you- I know now. I know who I am. I mean- I'm not a lawyer, I'm not a CFO, I'm not a cop. Hell I'm not even an escape artist. Those Steven Russells are dead. And now, all that's left is the man that loves you. That's all. Nothing else. I'm just the man that loves you. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you can see that... believe it... then I promise I'll never be anything else ever again. A LONG, LONG SILENCE.   Phillip looks to him. PHILLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know you're not bullshitting me again? Steven pauses.   He looks Phillip square in the eye. STEVEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't. And as Phillip stares at him-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages      5-23-08 A long SILENCE.   Then finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a window, a CLERK stamps a few documents and hands them to Steven, who is dressed in his lawyer attire. Steven exits the line and ducks into a nearby bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the urinal, Steven whistles to himself. SUPER: "Steven Russell was arrested two weeks later trying to secure Phillip's release." Steven turns his head to find the man at the next urinal staring at him. It's a very surprised Birkheim with a badge affixed to his jacket reading, "JUROR". Steven SMILES at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven sits in court while a FEMALE D.A. argues her case. SUPER: "An embarrassment to the State of Texas and Governor George Bush, Steven was given an unprecedented life sentence." She nods to the audience where Lindholm sits smiling. SUPER: "Coincidentally, the D.A. who prosecuted him was the Sister in law of Dan Lindholm- Steven's former boss"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven smiles wide, shackled in a solitary 6 by 7 cell. SUPER: "Steven sits in 23 hour-a-day lockdown, with only one hour a day for supervised showers and exercise." Steven stares at his Key West CALENDAR with a small photo of Phillip attached to it. The cell brightens, everything around Steven blooms with white light. He looks to see. "I Love You Phillip Morris"   Green Pages     5-23-08

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEVEN'S POV. Phillip also enveloped in white light, sits on the bow of staring at him with a smile. Steven smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER:   "On average, there are 1.7 Friday the 13ths a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIREN BLARES over a wide of the facility. Small in frame, we see Steven running from the prison gaining ground on the two guards chasing him.
